findings.title: AquaToken.sol Token susceptible to front running
findings.description: Changing the account allowance through the `approve()` method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering.

findings.title: Possible Ether loss in withdrawWithPermission()
findings.description: The function `withdrawWithPermission()` transfers the contract's Ether balance to the `indexFundV2` without checking if the variable `indexFundV2` is set, which can cause possible Ether loss.

findings.title: UniswapHandlerV3.sol: Function update() - parameter pool validation is not sufficient
findings.description: The function `update()` decodes the `pool` value from the supplied `data` parameter without validating its relation to the UniswapV3 positions NFT token, allowing a caller of the `AquaProtocol.stake()` function to specify a valid pool with lowest fees and highest premiums when staking any UniswapV3 positions NFT tokens.

findings.title: IndexFund.sol Migrated contract can cause loss of tokens
findings.description: The function `burnAndWithdraw` does not implement any checks to ensure whether the `IndexFund` contract is migrated or active, which prevents a user from accidentally calling the method and burning tokens.

findings.title: Add missing zero address validations
findings.description: The contracts do not validate the address in the parameter or storage, which can cause unintentional loss of funds.

findings.title: Administrative accounts could drain funds if compromised
findings.description: Some administrative accounts could drain funds if compromised.

findings.title: AccessController.sol Allows whitelisting non-existent pools
findings.description: The methods `updatePremiumOfPool` and `updatePoolStatus` allow updating the values of a non-existent pool, resulting in whitelisting a pool without using the `addPools` method.

findings.title: AquaToken.sol: Consider emitting events for all allowance updates
findings.description: The AquaToken contract does not emit an Approve event when the allowance value is updated during transferFrom.

findings.title: AquaToken.sol: Token supports minting to zero address
findings.description: The AquaToken contract prevents the zero address from holding tokens in both burn and transfer methods but does not implement such checks for minting, resulting in `address(0)` having some tokens that can never be burnt or transferred.

findings.title: AccessController.sol: updatePrimary() does not emit an event
findings.description: The function `updatePrimary()` defined in the `UniswapV3 AccessController.sol` does not emit an event - it is not consistent with the `UniswapV2 AccessController.updatePrimary()` which does emit the `AquaPrimaryUpdated` event.
